name: King's Kush
description: King's Kush, bred by Green House Seeds, derives from OG Kush and the elusive Grape strain. With gradual but powerful effects, King's Kush is famous for its potency and shiny trichromes during flowering. This strain comes across as sweet and sour with a powerful and tangy grape scent, as well as some hints of lavender. The flowering time for King Kush is approximately 9 weeks, at which point purple and blue veins will appear on the plant. King Kush's THC content can be up to 20%.
descriptionPlain: King's Kush, bred by Green House Seeds, derives from OG Kush and the elusive Grape strain. With gradual but powerful effects, King's Kush is famous for its potency and shiny trichromes during flowering. This strain comes across as sweet and sour with a powerful and tangy grape scent, as well as some hints of lavender. The flowering time for King Kush is approximately 9 weeks, at which point purple and blue veins will appear on the plant. King Kush's THC content can be up to 20%.

highlightedReviews.text:
Bow down to the KING KUSH! Wow! I've been eying this strain at Delta 9 in Van Nuys - researching the shit out of King Kush. And I could not wait until I could taste such a beautiful flower.

I usually focus on hybrids and sativas as I really love the cranial love I get from them. But today I had to get a gram of the King Kush. This is indica gold... Midas is touching my brain right now and I am blissing out at the mellow vibe that is flowing over me and saturating my bones.

Sticky and dense, with a hint of cheese and musk in the nose. So sticky and dank that I could barely pull apart the nug. My little aluminum diamond grinder took a lot of effort to mince. Damn.

I vaped a trench on the Magic Flight Box. Candied lemon rind and pine, I would even say spruce. Candied lemon rind and spruce. Sweet even and went down smooth. Exhaling lifted your nose with hints of pine and hash. A cuban cigar of vapes... And then it hits your head.

Wow, does it ever grab your head from the inside, pushing softly outwards. Dry mouth almost immediately, but don't let that dissuade you. This is a comforting softness that warms you from the inside. Currently listening to dub-step and I am in audible heaven! Then a blanket of pain relief hits your shoulders and drops down into your core. This warms you from the inside out. My tongue and the tips of my fingers and toes are tingling.

Huge euphoria - massive! Great uplifting and smiles. Warm, soft smiles - maybe just a wicked snicker hiding. And man, this makes me horny (TMI, I know). This is a beautiful high, fade, whatever you want to call this, it is beautiful.

I'm saving up for an eighth or maybe even splurge and get a 1/4 and make the best damn cookies EVER! (Yes, I'll save some flower for vape-night.

If you find the King Kush - do not pass it up.

Shitfuckatasticka!  (say that three times stoned on the King!)
My Buds are grape sweet an sour no menthol aroma. Please change the favor an effect about this strain cause they are wrong

articles.title: Wicked Awesome: 10 Strains to Celebrate the Boston Red Sox World Series Win
articles.author: Rebecca Kelley
articles.text:
Last night, the Boston Red Sox beat the St. Louis Cardinals in a 4-2 series to clinch their eighth World Series title in franchise history. For those of you cannabis consumers who are also fans of The Sawx (or for BoSox fans who are also cannabis consumers — after all, you did have a player on your team named Smoky Joe Wood), what better way to celebrate your beloved team's third World Series win in 10 seasons than with the following strains:
1. Cherry Pie

They say baseball is as American as apple pie, but in honor of Boston's red-hued winners, we think you should opt for cherry this go around. 
2. East Coast Sour Diesel

Not only do the Sox rule the east coast, they reign supreme over the entire nation.
3. Dynamite

To celebrate a dynamite season, of course.
4. Lifesaver

Knowing how die-hard Boston sports fans are, the Sox's win may very well have lifted their spirits out of some hard times. 
5. Jillybean

For Beantown, duh.
6. Euphoria

Ride that wave straight to the victory parade!
7. Red Haze

I'm guessing this is the current state of the entire city of Boston. 
8. King Kush

This one's in honor of the "King of October," David Ortiz, who was awarded MVP.  
9. Holy Grail Kush

What bigger Holy Grail exists in baseball other than a World Series win? 
And, of course: 
10. F*cking Incredible

Congratulations, Red Sox! And congrats to the city of Boston. As a native Michigander, I will continue to weep over the Tigers' continued inability to execute in the playoffs. 
photo credits: nancydowd, Werner Kunz, kim.rossi, Werner Kunz, Aero Racer E, bunkosquad, sea turtle, ctsilva, joyosity, B Rosen via photopin cc
